qas.question: What sea is North of the Sahara Desert?

What climate has cool and rainy summers?

plausible_answers.text: Frank White and geographer Robert Capot-Rey

qas.question: who claims the northern Sahara corresponds to the southern limit of date palm cultivation
What sea is located in Libya?
How much rain does northern Africa get?
What grass is typically found in Cyrenaica?

context: To the north, the Sahara skirts <b1_0><b5_0>the <a0_0>Mediterranean<b5_0/><b1_0/> Sea<a0_0/> in Egypt and portions of Libya, but in Cyrenaica and the Maghreb, the Sahara borders the <b2_0>Mediterranean forest<b2_0/>, woodland, and scrub ecoregions of <b6_0>northern Africa<b6_0/>, all of which have a <b3_0>Mediterranean climate<b3_0/> characterized by hot summers and cool and rainy winters. According to the botanical criteria of <b4_0>Frank White and geographer <b9_0>Robert Capot-Rey<b9_0/><b4_0/>, the northern limit of the Sahara corresponds to the northern limit of date palm cultivation and the southern limit of the range of <b8_0>esparto<b8_0/>, a grass typical of the Mediterranean climate portion of the Maghreb and Iberia. The northern limit also corresponds to the <b7_0>100 mm (3.9 in) isohyet<b7_0/> of annual precipitation.
